intro: Escallonia obtusissima, commonly known as the broad-leaved escallonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to southern South America, particularly Chile and Argentina, and is characterized by its glossy, dark green, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often cultivated as an ornamental shrub due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms. Escallonia obtusissima is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
